lines.text: Ain't no rules says a dog can't play basketball.
By the powers vested in me, I award custody of the dog to Josh Framm.
[Bang his Gavel]
Case closed. Thank God.
You can't do that! That dog is my dog! I got pictures!
Will somebody suppress that clown?
[the bailiff and the two police officers dragged the clown Norm Snively away and placed him under arrest. And the clown Norm Snively shouting]

[Josh is trying to play a trombone]
No, no, no. Don't blow so hard.
[Josh blows his trombone softer]
Okay, blow a little harder.
[Josh then blows the trombone's slide completely out; it falls to the ground, then other classmates and band members laugh at him]
Snively vs. Framm.
This one of your high-profile divorce cases?
No, sir. Custody.
Oh, custody.
[Then sees Buddy, unchained, in his courtroom]
Holy Toledo! What is that dog doing in the courtroom?
That's the uh, child, sir.
That's a pretty ugly kid.
[Observers laughing. Courtroom attendants laughs at his remarks]
It's a dog.
What?
The case is about custody of a dog.
All right, I'll take it, but we have to do this seriously. I will not have my courtroom turned into some kind of a circus.
[Norman Snively walks into the courtroom, dressed as a clown, shocking Judge Cranfield]
Who the hell are you?
Mr. Norman F. Snively, Your Honor. I'm the plaintiff.
[Dog growls]
You look like an idiot.

Why, thank you, sir. See, I'm a clown by profession. Happy Slappy's the name. Clown and the Hound. Begging your humblest pardon, I thought it might be helpful to Your Honor, if I appeared here today in the guise most pertinent to the cogent and unequivocal stating of my case.
Whatever, whatever. Y-Y-You got first, clown.
Well, the fact is, Your Honor, that dog's my property, and I have papers to prove it.
Well, would you show them to me, please?
Well, actually, Your Honor, I-I had papers to prove it. But that boy - that young hooligan - because of his irresponsible and criminal activity, is responsible for what you see.
[Crowds murmuring. And Judge Cranfield bangs his gavel in order in the court]
Order!
[Dog barking]

You see, sir, when I lost my dog for the first time, it broke me up real bad. When I lost him the second, it darn near killed me. Hell's bells, Your Honor, All I wanna do is get Old Blue back. So it can be him and me together just like it always was.
Why? So you can abuse him some more?
That will be enough, young man.
[Judge Cranfield bangs his gavel. Dog barking]
I raised that dog from puppy. I wouldn't harm a hair on his head!
[Crowds yelling. Judge Cranfield bangs his gavel in order in the court. Dog barking]
Bailiff, what is that?
The dog, Your Honor.
Oh.
[Crowds talking]
Order!
[Judge Cranfield bangs his Gavel in order in the court. Dog barking]
Quiet!
[Judge Cranfield bangs his gavel in order in the court. Dog barking]

[starts looking for Buddy after he wakes up Christmas morning]
Buddy
[not seeing him under the bed where he expected]
Buddy?
[leaps out of bed alarmed by not finding him]
Buddy!

[he runs downstairs, finds Buddy, beside Jackie, with a Christmas ribbon on his forehead]
Merry Christmas, Josh!

[hugs Buddy, extra heavily, causing Buddy to whine]
Thank you mom. thank you, thank you, thank you, thank you!
[after Josh's 3-point field-goal, leading the Timberwolves to victory over Warriors]
That's my son!
Water boy! Nice shot.

[after Larry scores an unassisted field-goal, alone]
Larry, out!
What are you taking me out for?
What the hell do you think you are doin'?
Time, ref!
[referee then blew whistle, for time-out]
Why are you takin' my kid out for?
'Cause he's playin' like he's a one-man team.
This boy *is* the team!
Maybe, he is to a worked-up father, but to me, he's a player who's got a whole lot to learn. Now, kindly to take your seat, Mr. Willingham, and let me get back to coaching my team.

[angrily]
Come on, Larry. We're leavin'!
But Dad.

[More irate and quicker]
Now!
May I have your attention, please? Uh, we have a real treat for you folks. I'd like you to all welcome our own guard, Josh Framm. And the new mascot, for the Timberwolves basketball team, Air-Bud!
Great.
[Josh brings Buddy to the basketball rim, tosses a basketball to get Buddy pop up and through the net. Buddy was not ready, the audience laughs while teammate Timberwolves lightly moan]

[sighs]
Let's go. Let's go. Come on, I'm just playing. Yeah, good boy. Just, like we always do. You already showed me that. Don't worry about all those people out there. Hey, good boy. Yeah, good boy. Let's go. Come on. Let's go, boy.
[bounces basketball on floor once]
Come on. Let's go. Good boy. You wanna play?
[tosses basketball towards Buddy; while it is in the air in front of Buddy's face, Buddy knocks it up and into rim for a basket; the audience cheers]
[Josh comes into gymnasium late]
Framm! You're late!
I'm here to try out for the team.

[laughing]
He can't try out. He's the water boy.
Framm! Where did you get that?
It was in my locker.
Well, it wasn't supposed to be.
Would it be too much trouble if I tried out anyway?
Coach, just let him.
All right, but if you slow down my tryout, I'm gonna have to pull you out.
[after Buddy got to basketball championship game. Josh and other Timberwolves hugs Buddy. Coach Chaney quickly put Buddy into the game, replacing a fouled-out Timberwolf]
Are they nuts?
What's the matter, gentlemen? Afraid your team might get beat by a dog?

[the two Warriors coaches answer together]
Put him in.
[Coach Chaney quickly and quietly laughs, slightly diabolically]

[off-screen]
Josh, I'm home!
Buddy, stay here and don't move until I come back.
[leaves the bathroom quickly and walks downstairs]

[doing something for Andrea]
There, you go.
Hi, Mom. Can I help with the groceries?
Excuse me?
Can I help with the groceries? How was your day?
Okay, what's going on?
Nothing! Can't a guy help his mom with the groceries?
[upstairs, Buddy quietly nudges the basketball Josh used to get him into the tub out of the bathroom to the top stair of the staircase]
What did you do?
Mom, do you remember, when I had a hamster?
Do you want another hamster?
No! Not exactly.
Josh, spit it out!
[Buddy nudges the basketball off of top stair and as it bounced downstairs, it starts causing numerous paint spills]

[shrieking]
Oh, my God! Oh, my God!

[as Buddy is chasing the basketball downstairs, he got wrapped up and covered by a new piece of wallpaper that come back off the wall Then a five-gallon bucket of white paint spills over Buddy's backbones causing Buddy, to shake off a majority of the paint, off of his fur onto Jackie and Josh's faces]
No!
Buddy! Ew! So, can I keep him?
[Jackie quietly gets the paint off her eyelids and looks at Josh, as if shouting "How dare you!"]

[During first Timberwolves & Warriors basketball game, Buddy comes into gymnasium and knocked basketball out of a Warrior's grip]
Buddy!
[Both teams start chasing Buddy, to try to get the basketball back, saying "Get him!"]
Buddy, stop!
Hey, gimme that ball.

[Loose basketball then hits a Gatorade ice-chest, causing a big spill on gymnasium floor]
Excuse me.
Get back here.

[basketball hits referee in his forehead, making him walk to bench. Meanwhile, the other referee loses his balance and slides into a table, hitting one set of legs, causing the table to fold on end nearly injure him]
Buddy, no!
[Buddy then causes a rack of basketballs to spill, onto floor]
Buddy, no!
[Josh gets the basketball, then Buddy knocks it, out of Josh's hands and up into basketball rim for a bucket. Audience and referees are a -first in shock and then start cheering for Buddy]
Buddy, bad dog!
Sorry, Josh. Come on, Buddy.

[after the game]
Hey, boy.
Did you know that Buddy could do that? Did you know that Buddy could play basketball?

[chuckling]
There he is! Oh, the man of the hour! And the dog! I swear, I wouldn't have believed it, if I hadn't seen it with my own two eyes! A basketball-playing dog! A regular Michael "Woof" Jordan! You've been keeping this under your hats! Oh, I'm going off like a faucet. Melissa, this is Mrs. Framm... and her talented son, Josh.
Hi.
Hi.
I'm the president, of the Booster Club and wondered if you and...
Buddy.
Buddy could do that trick, at the next half-time show.
Wouldn't he be a great mascot?

[Buddy leaves them, going back to the gymnasium, having overheard Coach Barker shouting at and mistreating Timberwolf Tom Stewart]
Buddy? Buddy!
You're never going to drop another ball, Stewart!
[starts throwing a group of basketballs at Tom Stewart too hard and to fast for him to successfully catch any of them, to vent out his anger]

[opens the gymnasium door]
What's going on here?
Just running Tom through a little drill.
That'll be enough, Joe. That will be enough.

[Josh pets Buddy's head at gymnasium door]
Good boy!

[on phone with agent]
Oh wait, the Oprah woman... Oprah, you know, the Oprah woman, she like dogs? I'd LOVE to do Jay Leno!
[sees Josh releasing Buddy from the chain]
Hey!

[just after lightly hitting Buddy's cage, and opening it, in the street]
Is everyone OK?

[in the car seat]
No.

[on phone]
No, no, I don't want my dog doing beer commercials.
It's the gavel, sir.
What? Speak up!
[Dog Barking. Judge Cranfield bangs his Gavel in order in the court. Dog barking]
Bailiff!
You said speak.
[Dog barking]
Speak!
[Dog barking]
Will somebody please suppress that dog?
[Observers laughing]
Shh!
Oh, what a day. What a day.
[Judge Cranfield drinks his glass of water]
Ugh.
[Glass thuds]
Now then - young man, have you any evidence... that this man abused your dog? Did you ever see him hit the dog?
Well... no.
Then how did you know the dog was abused?
[light chuckle]
Because Buddy doesn't like him. Buddy's my friend. I know what he's feeling, so he knows what I'm feeling. I spilled beer all over my wife.
He's telling the truth, Your Honor.
Who's that?
Boy's mother.
Oh, it's all right, you may sp - You may address the court.

When we first moved to this town, um, my son... was uh, very unhappy. And then he found Buddy here. And, um, Buddy's given him somebody to look forward to. Please, please, don't take Buddy away from my son.
Mrs. Framm, as far as this court is concerned, the dog is property unless you have evidence...

Your Honor. All these people here did not come here because of a piece of property, Your Honor. They came here because of Buddy. He's part of this town. And he's part of the team, and he's part of our family now, Your Honor.
Well, he's part of my family, too!
[Crowds booing]
He's like a son to me!
[Crowds booing]
Aw, shut up!
[Judge Cranfield bangs his gavel in order in the court. Dog barking. Court case of Snively vs. Framm just started and Timberwolves Coach Arthur Chaney just walked into the courtroom, unexpectedly]
Why not let the dog choose, Your Honor? They say a dog is man's best friend. If that's the case, shouldn't the dog be able to choose who he wants to be friends with?
Who are you, Barnum or Bailey?
Arthur Chaney, Your Honor.
Mr. Chaney, do you reali -
[stammers in shock]
Arthur Chaney? New York Knicks, '56? Huh. I was at that Celtics game where you did the turnaround jumper at the buzzer. I - I spilled beer all over my wife.
[Crowds laughter]
Your Honor.
What? Oh, yes, yes, yes.
[Clears his throat. Bangs Gavel. Dog Barking]
Mr. Chaney.
Well, I've been thinking. Uh. This dog's what, three, four years old. That makes him an adult in our years. I say let Buddy decide.
[Observers murmuring]
Mr. Chaney, during my 40 years on the bench, I have heard a lot of lamebrain cockamanie proposals, but this one... I like.

[a day or two after Principal Pepper fired Coach Barker; knocks on her office door]
Mrs. Pepper?
Mm-hmm.
Um, have you found a basketball coach yet?
Mm-hmm. Yes, Larry's father volunteered. Just until we find a new P. E. teacher.

[starts to leave, but then goes back to her door]
Okay.
Mm-hmm.

[opens her door, the second time]
Would it be weird, if I make a suggestion?

[Just after Josh did a light quick kiss, on her forehead, as he was about to leave the house]
What's with Josh?
Does he dribble?
No, but he might drool a little bit.
[Josh comes into the gym for the first tryout]
Check out the new kid.
It looks like he stole that ball from the Harlem Globetrotters.
[Josh climbs up the bleachers past Larry]
How you doin', buddy?
All right, listen up!
[Josh takes his seat as Coach Barker approaches]
basketball. Now, I've got five of my boys back from last year, including leading scorer Larry Willingham. Raise your hands, gentlemen.
[Larry, Greg and three other boys raise their hands]
This year, we are going all the way. Why's that, Willingham?
Because we're winners, sir.
That's right. We are here to win, because if you can win on the courts, you can win at life. Get your butts out here and let's see if you can play ball.
[Coach Barker blows his whistle and everyone comes out on the court and begins playing except Josh]
What team you playing for? What team you playing for?

[in unison]
Timberwolves!
Who's gonna win?

[in unison]
Timberwolves!
Who's gonna win?

[in unison]
Timberwolves!
I can't hear you!

[in unison]
Timberwolves!
What team's gonna win?

[in unison]
Timberwolves!
